item.description:
TAKE A FEW MINUTES AND REVIEW ALL THE TRIP DETAILS BELOW!  Email me directly (jmmoran@nycap.rr.com) with any questions!  - Julie.


EVENT ORGANIZER: 

Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{ AT }} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (PLEASE, NO PHONE CALLS UNTIL THE WEEKEND OF THE EVENT). You can send text messages to me as well.

 

Difficulty:  About a 7.5-mile hike, about 2,700 Feet Elevation Change;  at 1.5 miles / hour, this is about a five-hour hike.  

Car Spot Meetup Time,  White Elephant: 7 a.m.



LINK TO GOOGLE MAPS (CLICK HERE) -- Estimated Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from Boston MA to the meetup location, then up Barnjum Road to the AT junction, start of the hike.

 

ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light / head lamp, food / snacks / water, first aid items, sun screen, cell phone, camera.  Bring extra layers as temps continue to head downward; expect summit temps to approach freezing.

 

Diapensia, growing near the Mt. Abraham summit.




NARRATIVE AND UPDATES (09-26-2011 10 pm): 

I'm having fun picking off the last few remaining new England Hundred Highest peaks along with my new friend Ed.  This is another 4,000-footer hike in Maine's Longfellow Mountains ... pleasant logging roads with fall foliage and flowers in blazing color will give way to scratchy spruce trees, older and more fragrant as we ascend way above treeline.  This trip is in conjunction with another romp in the Maine's Western Mountains the previous day, including Boundary Peak that is best accessed from the Quebec side of the border, in the Mt. Orford park.  My plan is that we will spend the night either at motels in town or at the Main roadhouse.  Then we'll rendezvous at this small unpretentious breakfast place, and test out a new access strategy to Mt. Abraham from Barnjum Maine -- we'll see how far we make it up the logging roads this time!  

NOTE:  If weather reports change to unfavorable, I WILL RESCHEDULE. Also, all my hikes are dog friendly (and Mike will be coming!) -- if you don't like dogs, don't come.


Mike, hanging out near the summit of Mt. Abraham, last September 2010. The scene was magic even while the mountain was socked in.


 


MAPS, TRIP PLANS AND RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:


Mt. Abraham 

LINK:  

FranklinSites.Com Hiking Guide

LINK:   

alavigne.net

LINK: 

Hike New Hampshire

LINK: 

SummitPost.org

LINK: 

adrianpayeur.com


WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY OF MY HIKING EVENTS.

SEE YOU THERE! Julie and Mike 

 

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the following:  If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.  Full waiver can be found elsewhere on this site.  THANK YOU FOR UNDERSTANDING AND FOR HIKING SAFE!
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.name: MAINE (NEHH) SERIES: Mt. Abraham!
